greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Start with a(1) = 1; then numbers 1 .. primepi(2), followed by numbers 1 .. primepi(3), and then numbers 1 .. primepi(4), ..., etc, where A000720 gives primepi.
comment: Can be used to construct the irregular table A249809.

This is a fractal sequence; i.e., the removal of the first occurrence of each term in A249727 leaves A249727, so that the sequence contains itself infinitely many times.  The corresponding interspersion is A272616. - _Clark Kimberling_, May 12 2016
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10016
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 06 2014
